SEARCH
Package org.example.menu

Class PharmacistMenu

java.lang.Object
org.example.menu.PharmacistMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
Menu
public class PharmacistMenu extends Object implements Menu
PharmacistMenu is a menu for the pharmacist to interact with the system.

The menu allows the pharmacist to view appointment outcome records, dispense prescriptions, view medication inventory, submit replenishment requests, update the password, and log out.

  • Constructor Details

    • PharmacistMenu

      public PharmacistMenu(Scanner scanner, StaffRepository staffRepository, MedicineRepository medicineRepository, AppointmentOutcomeRecordRepository appointmentOutcomeRecordRepository, MedicineRequestRepository medicineRequestRepository, PrescriptionRepository prescriptionRepository)

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Start the pharmacist menu.

      Pharmacist needs to log in. The menu will then display available options, and the user will be prompted to choose an action. The menu will continue to run until the pharmacist logs out.

      Specified by:
      start in interface Menu

    • login

      public void login()
      Log in the pharmacist to the system. The pharmacist will be prompted to enter their user ID and password. If the credentials are valid, the pharmacist is logged in, and the menu is displayed. If not, the system prompts the pharmacist to re-enter the credentials until they are correct.
      Specified by:
      login in interface Menu

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu()
      Display the main menu for the pharmacist. The menu includes options for viewing appointment outcome records, dispensing prescriptions, viewing medication inventory, submitting replenishment requests, updating the password, and logging out. If there are any medicines with low stock, a warning is displayed at the top of the menu.
      Specified by:
      displayMenu in interface Menu

    • handleChoice

      public void handleChoice(int choice)
      Handle the pharmacist's menu choice. Each choice corresponds to a specific action, such as viewing appointment outcome records, dispensing prescriptions, or updating the password. The method redirects to the appropriate handler function based on the user's input.
      Specified by:
      handleChoice in interface Menu
      Parameters:
      choice - The selected menu option

    • viewAppointmentOutcomeRecord

      public void viewAppointmentOutcomeRecord()
      Display all appointment outcome records that have pending prescriptions. This allows the pharmacist to see which appointments require prescription dispensing.

    • dispensePrescription

      public void dispensePrescription()
      Dispense pending prescriptions for an appointment. The pharmacist is prompted to enter an appointment ID, view the pending prescriptions, and mark them as dispensed. The pharmacist can dispense multiple prescriptions in one session.

    • viewMedicationInventory

      public void viewMedicationInventory()
      View the inventory of all medicines. The pharmacist can choose to view only low-stock medicines or all medicines. The inventory is displayed in a formatted table with medicines that are low on stock highlighted.

    • submitReplenishmentRequest

      public void submitReplenishmentRequest()
      Submit a replenishment request for low stock medicines. The pharmacist can review the low stock medicines and select which ones to request for replenishment. The request is then submitted to the MedicineRequestRepository.

    • updatePassword

      public void updatePassword()
      Update the password for the logged-in pharmacist. The pharmacist is prompted to enter a new password, which is then updated in the StaffRepository.
